LXXXI. Eratosthenes is quite ignorant of the geography of Iberia and sometimes makes absolutely contradictory statements about it. He says, for instance, that its western coast as far as Cadiz is inhabited by Galatae, since the whole western side of Europe, as far south as Cadiz, is occupied by that people; and then, quite forgetting he had said this, when taking a survey of the whole of Spain he nowhere mentions the Galatae-‘³ . . .
